commentBody: Belichick is a very good football coach, no doubt. But without the great Tom Brady, the Patriots aren't reaching the AFC championship 5 consecutive times.

replies.commentBody:
Pure speculation.

Belichick is easily the greatest coach of the modern era, arguably the greatest of all time. He's certainly the greatest team architect of the salary cap era.

He's also responsible for drafting, and building an offensive system around Brady. Who's to say he wouldn't have found an exceptional quarterback in Brady's absence? Or that Brady, in a different organization, would have been pedestrian? You can also argue that he wouldn't have been able to reach 5 consecutive AFC championships without players like Wilfork, Edelman, Revis, Welker, and Gronkowski.

Great coaches make great players and vice versa.
